sub_title: Experienced multilingual Sales Support, Customer Service, Sales Operations, Trainer and Coach. Professional Scrum Master
summary:
Experienced, highly customer-focused multilingual professional in people management, all aspects of international customer service, training and coaching.  Expert in SAP, SOX, revenue recognition, export, incoterms, process documentation and improvement.

I have worked in all the following areas of customer service: technical support, order entry, sales support, logistics and export; with colleagues and customers from many different nationalities and parts of the world, and so I am good at explaining and training at every level.

Languages: native UK English, fluent French, Dutch and Turkish, good German.

While working full-time, I have completed an MBA (graduation 2014) and constantly aim to learn more and improve myself.

education.field_of_study: China: what everyone needs to know

profile_positions.description: Working on projects to improve processes and procedures and quality
profile_positions.title: Service Improvement Manager
Customer Support Analyst

profile_positions.description:
Distribution of vaccines, controlled drugs, prescription medicines, life-saving, cold-chain and/or medical-critical products to pharmacies, hospitals and distributors for GSK and ViiV Healthcare.
Customer service and order management using SAP in line with EU Good Distribution Practices for medicinal products.
Verifying orders received by EDI, monitoring if EDI errors happen, and troubleshooting.
Resolving complaints.
Deciding priorities in the case of shortages.
Sending out samples.
Dealing with two 3PL warehouses (Ceva, Alloga) and replenishing from FR to NL.
Communicating with supply chain hub about forecasts and inbound deliveries (increase/decrease, earlier/later) and creating files to inform colleagues about possible stockouts/issues.
Working with quality department to block/unblock products/batches. Co-ordinating product recall.
PGI/PGR outbound/inbound deliveries in SAP. Stock comparison.
Requesting price and customer master data changes in SAP.
Creating work instructions, reviewing and correcting SOPs.
Creating customer satisfaction survey.
profile_positions.title: Interim Customer Service Officer via Yacht

profile_positions.description:
Customer service, order management and invoicing using Exact
Financial administration, chasing late payers
Office management, hiring and supervising interns
Picking, packing and shipping
profile_positions.title: Chief of Operations
Senior Manager, Sales Support EMEA (Philips & AOC brands)

profile_positions.description:
Since August 2009:  Order Desk Specialist Europe
MMD Monitors & Displays market and sell Philips brand monitors and signage products.  AOC is the own brand of TPV monitors.
- Customers (retailers, resellers, distributors) in Europe, Turkey and Russia
- Entering orders in SAP and checking all data e.g. pricing, tax code, pallet size, incoterms, payment terms, shipping & pricing dates; ensuring all export documents are provided and special requirements considered.
- Orders shipped direct to customer from factories in China (FOB containers) as well as from NL warehouse.
- Liaising with other depts, locations, external logistics providers
- Claims, RMAs, credits, price protection, extended warranty.
- Assisting communications between F&A dept and customers, mainly in France.
- Translation
Since April 2011: Supervisor Order Desk.  All the above, plus:
- Working with SAP consultants to improve processes, UAT.
- Escalations, complaint resolution
- Managing holidays and absences to ensure enough coverage at all times
- Training of new colleagues.  Coaching colleagues and resolving complicated issues.
- Backup of Senior Operations Manager.
Since January 2012:  Sales Support Manager Europe, MMD (Philips) and AOC brands.  All the above, plus:
- Performance appraisals, KPI setting
- Recruiting new team members
- Sell in/out reports
- Sign off expenses, credits

- 2009 :Implementation of a new SAP system and 3PL warehouse and EDI between the two.
- 2011: implementation, launch and continued management of the first MMD consignment stock at a customer location.
- 2011: transfer of AOC Order Desk and Finance Dept from Berlin to Amsterdam, AOC SAP system launch and training of a new team.
- 2012: Merge of AOC & MMD order desks so responsibilites are based on languages, not brands. Harmonization of processes, cross training. AOC warehouse combined with MMD's.
- mid 2013: Middle East and Africa region added
- mid 2014: hospitality TV added, SAP testing, integration of new BU
profile_positions.title: Senior Manager, Sales Support EMEA (Philips & AOC brands)

profile_positions.description: I was responsible for the entire order process from receiving the order from customers (hospitals) by phone, fax or e-mail to invoicing.  The order management system was JDE and orders were shipped by an external logistics provider, DSV Solutions.  I managed the surgery diary for the sales team and ensured all the implants and accessories, as well as the salespeople, were in the operating theatre at the right time and that after the procedure(s), the products were returned or invoiced quickly, as appropriate. I scheduled and carried out cycle counts of customer consignment locations.  I worked within SOX requirements and managed accruals.  I managed the back order in case of critical products. I liaised with other departments and office locations as required.  I was also the backup for the BeNeLux team.  I also functioned as a backup for my Team Lead and the Supply Chain Manager.  I wrote the work instructions for new colleagues learning to work with JDE.
profile_positions.title: Customer Service Representative UK

profile_positions.description:
In this role I offered technical support over the telephone to users of in-house veterinary laboratory equipment in English, French and German and distributors throughout the EMEA region.  I logged calls and cases in SAP and dealt with complaints.  I gave training to new employees and was the Customer Interaction Coach for the UK team, which involved monitoring and assessing calls and working with each member of the team to set and achieve team and individual goals.  I was promoted to Technical Support Representative Level II in November 2003, which involved supervision and assistance of Level I Representatives.  On several occasions I went out on the road with a sales representative or independently, meeting customers face-to-face and troubleshooting and repairing their instruments, and represented IDEXX at veterinary congresses in the UK and Ireland.  I also wrote the work instruction documents for new colleagues learning to work with SAP and gave the SAP training (including Sarbox compliance). In July 2006 I became the Country Process Lead for the UK team, which meant that in addition to my duties as described above, I became responsible for all UK processes for Technical Support and Customer Support (Order Entry), I coached my colleagues in process issues, and reviewed the team’s call tracking.  I was the first point of escalation for the team for technical and customer issues.  I did the planning and scheduling for the team (of 12 people) and was responsible for ensuring sufficient telephone coverage.
During my time at IDEXX I also attended a 3-day Dale Carnegie Immersion Seminar and an IDEXX/Dale Carnegie Project Management Training course.
profile_positions.title: Country Process Lead UK

profile_positions.description: Provided technical support to end-users of the sales database software ACT! in English, French and German.  Mentor to new employees.  Worked on department newspaper.
profile_positions.title: Technical Support Representative
